alert.note: Alert for Frederick (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 3:52PM EDT until May 08 at 11:00AM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick County. For the Monocacy River...including Frederick...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Monocacy River near Frederick. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Significant lowland flooding is occurring along the river, with backwater flooding also occurring. Numerous roads are closed. Water is approaching the parking lot at Gambrill Mill on the Monocacy National Battlefield. Backwater flooding from Carroll Creek is likely approaching the underside of the bridge leading to the Frederick city wastewater treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 16.7 feet, or 1.7 feet above flood stage. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 3:30 PM EDT Saturday was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 17.3 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 12/05/1950. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River Name Fld Observed Sat Sun Sun Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 8PM 2AM 8AM Stg Time Date Monocacy River Frederick 15.0 16.7 Sat 3 pm 17.3 15.7 14.3 17.3 8pm Sat &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 400 AM EDT.
